Posts.Content: Arrow--are you sure 15cm? That's about 6". Regardless, I wish her the best of luck. My mom had breast cancer in 1998 and has had 2 recurrences. Both were in her armpit in the lymph nodes. The first time it manifested it through drainage in the lungs, and this time (yesterday diagnosis) it was a 2cm lump. Go visit your doctor, please... [This message has been edited by girlwondering (edited 06-18-2002).]
Posts.Title: Lump in armpit

Posts.Content: I agree with ToBeFreeToRoam. Try not to be worried and try to keep busy. The radiologist has a tough job--they are the final say as to whether something is or isn't wrong--and they have to be thorough! Be grateful for the time they spent! You may want to follow up with your doctor...let them know you are anxious for the results. They expect it. Keep calling if that makes you feel better. With my mother we were always proactive when finding out test results. Hope this helps, Keep us posted! We care! Karie
Posts.Title: Abnormal Mammogram...scared

Posts.Content: I was shocked to find pain in one of my breasts on Sunday. Feeling there, I felt a movable lump--much like a swollen duct or something--right where I have pain (on the side of my breast. I went to the GP today and she felt it too. I have now been referred to the breast center and don't know how I will wait that long (a few weeks she said). Anxiety builds as my mother died of breast cancer on Jan 7. She fought long and hard for 6 years. If this is a cyst, is there anything I can do to help it reduce in size or go away? I don't know what to do. Please help, Girl
Posts.Title: Painful lump in breast. :( Mother died of BC in January.

Posts.Content: Okay, well yesterday toward end of day the pain started to subside, and this morning, the lump feels like it is getting smaller too. I made a conscious decision to cut caffeine out of my diet--the weekend was a bit excessive--a large coffee, many non-decaf black teas, lots of chocolate, chocolate cookies, HobNobs (yum) and I thought it best to take the matter into my own hands! I had something (lump) before but by the time I got to the ultrasound it was GONE. Hopefully this is the same type of thing. Pain - reduced & lump - I think reduced (although may be my imagination), Girl
Posts.Title: Painful lump in breast. :( Mother died of BC in January.

Posts.Content: You may want to check in your area for reduced cost/supplemented mammograms if you are concerned. My mother had no insurance, yet had mammograms every year. I don't know where you'd start...maybe someone here will have a suggestion. As for other symptoms of breast cancer, I suspect there could be many and there could be none. Cancer is generally not painful. Best to try to keep on top of it all if you are able! (In that you are only 36, you may try to get subsidized government healthcare?) Karie
Posts.Title: I have several questions, need some help

Posts.Content: Mommy2Baz, I know you want reasurance, but unfortunately, nobody but your doctor can tell you what you're dealing with. We're all here for you, but to speculate on your lump would be too hard for me to do! I CAN tell you that the majority of all lumps ARE benign, so try to keep that in mind, despite your family history (which I have too!). Keep us posted, Karie
Posts.Title: Found a lump, waiting on U/S results...

Posts.Content: Kalie--Firstly, I admire your strength and wish you the best with all your treatments. I lost my mother to metastatic breast cancer (to the brain...but also present in the bones, lungs and on the skin) in January, so I can truly sympathize with your situation. She was first diagnosed in November 1998, and the first time it returned it was in 2001...September 11th (and I lived in NYC at the time...another story). She fought hard and was on so many drugs/chemos: doxorubicin and cycolphosphamide (A/C), Navelbine, taxol, taxotere, femara, Aredia, cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone (CHOP), morphine...I could go on and on. She also had radiation and spinal fusion surgery. She really suffered, but through it all it was up to our family to manage her medical care....and that is exactly what we did up until the very end. She survived substantially longer than she would have if we left it up to her doctor, and we are so grateful! Kudos to you for realizing this. Doctors have many hidden agendas (pharmaceutical kickbacks, too many patients, long hours, etc...). Know you are in my thoughts and prayers. I will keep looking to see how you're doing!
Posts.Title: Metastatic Breast Cancer -- anyone on Abraxane?

Posts.Content: I am so sorry for what you are going through. Know that positive attitude and supposrt from family & friends are the two most important things for your sister in law to have right now! Just off the internet: Stages Stage 1 Tumor <=2 cm with no lymph node metastasis Stage 2 Tumor >2 cm or positive lymph nodes Stage 3 Locally advanced Breast Cancer (Skin or Chest wall) Stage 4 Metastatic Breast Cancer (Lung, Liver, Bones, Brain) I will keep you in my prayers. Know that treatments have advanced a lot in the past and people CAN survive breast cancer!
Posts.Title: Need Breast Cancer info

Posts.Content: Any changes in breast tissue warrant a trip to your Doctor or GP. I have heard that dimpling or puckering can be a sign of breast cancer, but only a doctor would be able to tell you for sure! Keep us posted, Karie
Posts.Title: Breast puckering?

Posts.Content: Oh I am so sorry for your news. Just wanted to say that. Karie xox
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy Results 1 2

Posts.Content: Just to let you know, you are both in my thoughts and prayers. I can understand first-hand how tough this is--I am 34, my mother died of breast cancer after a 6 year battle (which ended last year) and early 2005 I found a series of lumps on my left breast, just under the armpit. Thankfully, they were lumps resulting from "cyclic changes" in my breasts. Please try to keep your chin up until you are given any definite news, whether positive or negative. Your spirit needs optimism or it is too hard to get through the day-to-day. Hugs to you both, Karie
Posts.Title: Lump under arm & in breast, biopsy in two weeks 1 2

Posts.Content: I just logged on to find out if you have had any results yet...Keeping you in my good thoughts! Please keep us up to date when you hear anything! Karie
Posts.Title: Found a lump, waiting on U/S results...

Posts.Content: I don't know what will be offered, however, if you aren't happy with the decision, ask for a referral to an oncologist yourself! My mother had bone metastasis from breast cancer, but when she was diagnosed, she was only 55. I have heard that age & fraility do make a difference in what treatment you will receive (it did as my mother aged with the disease) but the oncologist should still see her! Hope this helps, Keep us posted, Karie
Posts.Title: breast cancer with bone metatasis

Posts.Content: No, my mother passed away on January 7th of 2005. She had two major medical plans--Blue Cross and Blue Shield--however, neither covered hospice either. When I went back for Christmas (I live in London, she lives in California) last year with my husband, she was loopy...losing control of her body functions, unable to walk, unable to communicate, etc...We took her to the emergency room on the 26th of December where they found tumors on her brain and gave her 10 days. She lived exactly that, in the hospital cancer ward. She was incredibly happy there (the few days she was cognascent) and her doctors were more than happy to keep her there in lieu of taking her home (which was not an option). In hindsight, it was a blessed passing. HTH, Karie
Posts.Title: breast cancer with bone metatasis

Posts.Content: Prouddad, I too am thinking of you. I took a very similar journey with my mother back in 1998. She had infiltrating ductal as well, HER+. I suspect your wife be taking estrogen blockers for that...which is actually one blessing of having that type of bc (if there is a blessing). My mother too had Adriamycin/Cytoxan, Taxol & Herceptin...Reading your posts brought back so many memories. I will keep you & your wife in my thoughts and prayers. It's a tough dance, but she has the power to beat this beast! Best, Karie
Posts.Title: Possible breast cancer 1 2

Posts.Content: Ralinda30...I am SO VERY HAPPY for you! That's the best news! Congrats!
Posts.Title: Breast puckering?
